questions.question_text:
You have the following visualization.
//IMG//

The Last() calculation is set to compute using Table (across).
Which value will appear in the crosstab for the Consumer segment of the year 2018 if you change compute to use Order Date?

comments.content: Please why 3. the value of 2018 is 4. you correct me

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The answer is incorrect. last() uses 0 inclusively, therefore the highest value we can obtain is 3. When computed by order date, it would consider the latest date 0 while the 2018 date as a 3.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a dashboard than contains two sheets named Sheet 1 and Sheet 2.
You want to add an object to the dashboard that users can click to switch to a different dashboard in the workbook.
Which object should you add to the dashboard?
//IMG//

choices.D: From the context menu of Sales over time, select Remove Dashboard Item.
choices.B: From the context menu of Sales over time, select Ignore Actions.
choices.A: From the context menu of Sales over time, select Deselect.
choices.C: From the context menu of Profits by State, deselect Use as Filter

questions.question_text:
You have the following dashboard.
//IMG//

Currently, the map is used as a filter that affects the data on the other sheets of the dashboard.
You need to configure the dashboard to ensure that selecting a data point on the map only filters the Detail table.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. From the context menu of Sales over time, select Ignore Actions.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You have a dataset that contains daily sales by business segment from 2017 to the present.
You want to use monthly historical trends to predict sales by segment in the future.
Which three actions should you perform in order?
(Place the three correct options in order Use the arrows to move Options to Answer Area Use Answer Area arrows to re-order the options.)
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Answers it incorrect.
It should be: Put Order Date on columns and segment on rows. -> Aggregate the data to month year -> use forecasting

Add the date to the columns and segment to rows -> Aggregate the data to month and year -> Drag Forecast
(tested)

Selected Answer: C
C is correct, the second chart is a dual axis with an unsynchronised axes. 
D is incorrect, if you set discount to a dimension, it will create a point for every discount value.
B is incorrect, as it wouldn't even visualize the discount
A is incorrect as it would create a gradient on the initial axes ranging between the discount values.

Selected Answer: C
Set Discount to dual axis

Selected Answer: C
C. Set Discount to Dual Axis
C- Set discount as Dual axis when you right-click

choices.B: Drag Discount to the Columns shelf.
choices.A: Drag Discount to Color on the Marks card
